meanings.definition: To be thrifty or frugal in spending money.
meanings.sent1: She scrimps on unnecessary expenses to save for a vacation.
meanings.sent2: He scrimps on groceries to afford a new computer.
meanings.sent3: Mom always scrimps on gifts, but we love her homemade presents.
meanings.sent4: The company scrimps on employee benefits to maximize profits.
meanings.sent5: Scrimping on utilities during winter can lead to high bills later.

meanings.definition: To reduce or limit something in a stingy or inadequate way.
meanings.sent1: The chef scrimps on ingredients, affecting the taste of the dish.
meanings.sent2: Don't scrimps on paint for the walls; it will look patchy.
meanings.sent3: He scrimps on sleep, but then struggles to stay awake during the day.
meanings.sent4: The teacher scrimps on explanations, leaving the students confused.
meanings.sent5: Scrimping on time spent studying can result in poor grades.
